snippet: The exhumation of Pablo Neruda’s remains seeks to determine whether he died of poisoning instead of cancer, widely believed for almost 40 years to be the cause.
abstract: Remains of Pablo Neruda, Chile's Nobel Prize-winning poet, are exhumed so that they can be examined for signs of whether he died of poisoning instead of cancer, widely believed cause of death for almost 40 years.
lead_paragraph: The exhumation of Pablo Neruda’s remains seeks to determine whether he died of poisoning instead of cancer, widely believed for almost 40 years to be the cause.

headline.seo: Chile Exhumes Pablo Neruda in Inquiry
headline.main: Chile Exhumes Nobel Poet’s Body to Investigate Claim of Poisoning
headline.print_headline: Chile Exhumes Nobel Poet’s Body to Investigate Claim of Poisoning
